00032 #include "node_composite_util.h"
00033 
00034 /* **************** BILATERALBLUR ******************** */
00035 static bNodeSocketTemplate cmp_node_bilateralblur_in[]= {
00036     { SOCK_RGBA, 1, "Image", 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f}, 
00037     { SOCK_RGBA, 1, "Determinator", 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f}, 
00038     { -1, 0, "" } 
00039 };
00040 
00041 static bNodeSocketTemplate cmp_node_bilateralblur_out[]= { 
00042     { SOCK_RGBA, 0, "Image"}, 
00043     { -1, 0, "" } 
00044 };
00045 
00046 #define INIT_C3                                                               \
00047     mean0 = 1;                                                                \
00048     mean1[0] = src[0];                                                        \
00049     mean1[1] = src[1];                                                        \
00050     mean1[2] = src[2];                                                        \
00051     mean1[3] = src[3];                                                        \
00052     (void)0
00053 
00054 /* finds color distances */
00055 #define COLOR_DISTANCE_C3(c1, c2)                                             \
00056     ((c1[0] - c2[0])*(c1[0] - c2[0]) +                                        \
00057      (c1[1] - c2[1])*(c1[1] - c2[1]) +                                        \
00058      (c1[2] - c2[2])*(c1[2] - c2[2]) +                                        \
00059      (c1[3] - c2[3])*(c1[3] - c2[3]))
00060 
00061 /* this is the main kernel function for comparing color distances
00062  and adding them weighted to the final color */
00063 #define KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(k)                                                  \
00064     temp_color = src + deltas[k];                                             \
00065     ref_color = ref + deltas[k];                                              \
00066     w = weight_tab[k] +                                                       \
00067         (double)COLOR_DISTANCE_C3(ref, ref_color ) * i2sigma_color;           \
00068     w = 1.0/(w*w + 1);                                                        \
00069     mean0 += w;                                                               \
00070     mean1[0] += (double)temp_color[0] * w;                                    \
00071     mean1[1] += (double)temp_color[1] * w;                                    \
00072     mean1[2] += (double)temp_color[2] * w;                                    \
00073     mean1[3] += (double)temp_color[3] * w;                                    \
00074     (void)0
00075 
00076 /* write blurred values to image */
00077 #define UPDATE_OUTPUT_C3                                                      \
00078     mean0 = 1.0/mean0;                                                        \
00079     dest[x * pix + 0] = mean1[0] * mean0;                                     \
00080     dest[x * pix + 1] = mean1[1] * mean0;                                     \
00081     dest[x * pix + 2] = mean1[2] * mean0;                                     \
00082     dest[x * pix + 3] = mean1[3] * mean0;                                     \
00083     (void)0
00084 
00085 /* initializes deltas for fast access to neighbor pixels */
00086 #define INIT_3X3_DELTAS( deltas, step, nch )                                  \
00087     ((deltas)[0] =  (nch),  (deltas)[1] = -(step) + (nch),                    \
00088      (deltas)[2] = -(step), (deltas)[3] = -(step) - (nch),                    \
00089      (deltas)[4] = -(nch),  (deltas)[5] =  (step) - (nch),                    \
00090      (deltas)[6] =  (step), (deltas)[7] =  (step) + (nch));                   \
00091     (void)0
00092 
00093 
00094 /* code of this node was heavily inspired by the smooth function of opencv library.
00095 The main change is an optional image input */
00096 static void node_composit_exec_bilateralblur(void *UNUSED(data), bNode *node, bNodeStack **in, bNodeStack **out)
00097 {
00098     NodeBilateralBlurData *nbbd= node->storage;
00099     CompBuf *new, *source, *img= in[0]->data , *refimg= in[1]->data;
00100     double mean0, w, i2sigma_color, i2sigma_space;
00101     double mean1[4];
00102     double weight_tab[8];
00103     float *src, *dest, *ref, *temp_color, *ref_color;
00104     float sigma_color, sigma_space;
00105     int imgx, imgy, x, y, pix, i, step;
00106     int deltas[8];
00107     short found_determinator= 0;
00108 
00109     if (img == NULL || out[0]->hasoutput == 0)
00110         return;
00111 
00112     if (img->type != CB_RGBA) {
00113         img= typecheck_compbuf(in[0]->data, CB_RGBA);
00114     }
00115 
00116     imgx= img->x;
00117     imgy= img->y;
00118     pix= img->type;
00119     step= pix * imgx;
00120 
00121     if (refimg) {
00122         if (refimg->x == imgx && refimg->y == imgy) {
00123             if (ELEM3(refimg->type, CB_VAL, CB_VEC2, CB_VEC3)) {
00124                 refimg= typecheck_compbuf(in[1]->data, CB_RGBA);
00125                 found_determinator= 1;
00126             }
00127         }
00128     }
00129     else {
00130         refimg= img;
00131     }
00132 
00133     /* allocs */
00134     source= dupalloc_compbuf(img);
00135     new= alloc_compbuf(imgx, imgy, pix, 1);
00136     
00137     /* accept image offsets from other nodes */
00138     new->xof= img->xof;
00139     new->yof= img->yof;
00140 
00141     /* bilateral code properties */
00142     sigma_color= nbbd->sigma_color;
00143     sigma_space= nbbd->sigma_space;
00144     
00145     i2sigma_color= 1.0f / (sigma_color * sigma_color);
00146     i2sigma_space= 1.0f / (sigma_space * sigma_space);
00147 
00148     INIT_3X3_DELTAS(deltas, step, pix);
00149 
00150     weight_tab[0] = weight_tab[2] = weight_tab[4] = weight_tab[6] = i2sigma_space;
00151     weight_tab[1] = weight_tab[3] = weight_tab[5] = weight_tab[7] = i2sigma_space * 2;
00152 
00153     /* iterations */
00154     for (i= 0; i < nbbd->iter; i++) {
00155         src= source->rect;
00156         ref= refimg->rect;
00157         dest= new->rect;
00158         /*goes through image, there are more loops for 1st/last line and all other lines*/
00159         /*kernel element accumulates surrounding colors, which are then written with the update_output function*/
00160         for (x= 0; x < imgx; x++, src+= pix, ref+= pix) {
00161             INIT_C3;
00162 
00163             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(6);
00164 
00165             if (x > 0) {
00166                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(5);
00167                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(4);
00168             }
00169 
00170             if (x < imgx - 1) {
00171                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(7);
00172                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(0);
00173             }
00174 
00175             UPDATE_OUTPUT_C3;
00176         }
00177 
00178         dest+= step;
00179 
00180         for (y= 1; y < imgy - 1; y++, dest+= step, src+= pix, ref+= pix) {
00181             x= 0;
00182 
00183             INIT_C3;
00184 
00185             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(0);
00186             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(1);
00187             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(2);
00188             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(6);
00189             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(7);
00190 
00191             UPDATE_OUTPUT_C3;
00192 
00193             src+= pix;
00194             ref+= pix;
00195 
00196             for (x= 1; x < imgx - 1; x++, src+= pix, ref+= pix) {
00197                 INIT_C3;
00198 
00199                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(0);
00200                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(1);
00201                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(2);
00202                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(3);
00203                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(4);
00204                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(5);
00205                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(6);
00206                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(7);
00207 
00208                 UPDATE_OUTPUT_C3;
00209             }
00210 
00211             INIT_C3;
00212 
00213             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(2);
00214             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(3);
00215             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(4);
00216             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(5);
00217             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(6);
00218 
00219             UPDATE_OUTPUT_C3;
00220         }
00221 
00222         for (x= 0; x < imgx; x++, src+= pix, ref+= pix) {
00223             INIT_C3;
00224 
00225             KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(2);
00226 
00227             if (x > 0) {
00228                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(3);
00229                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(4);
00230             }
00231             if (x < imgx - 1) {
00232                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(1);
00233                 KERNEL_ELEMENT_C3(0);
00234             }
00235 
00236             UPDATE_OUTPUT_C3;
00237         }
00238 
00239         if (node->exec & NODE_BREAK) break;
00240 
00241         SWAP(CompBuf, *source, *new);
00242     }
00243 
00244     if (img != in[0]->data)
00245         free_compbuf(img);
00246 
00247     if (found_determinator == 1) {
00248         if (refimg != in[1]->data)
00249             free_compbuf(refimg);
00250     }
00251 
00252     out[0]->data= source;
00253 
00254     free_compbuf(new);
00255 }
00256 
00257 static void node_composit_init_bilateralblur(bNodeTree *UNUSED(ntree), bNode* node, bNodeTemplate *UNUSED(ntemp))
00258 {
00259     NodeBilateralBlurData *nbbd= MEM_callocN(sizeof(NodeBilateralBlurData), "node bilateral blur data");
00260     node->storage= nbbd;
00261     nbbd->sigma_color= 0.3;
00262     nbbd->sigma_space= 5.0;
00263 }
00264 
00265 void register_node_type_cmp_bilateralblur(bNodeTreeType *ttype)
00266 {
00267     static bNodeType ntype;
00268 
00269     node_type_base(ttype, &ntype, CMP_NODE_BILATERALBLUR, "Bilateral Blur", NODE_CLASS_OP_FILTER, NODE_OPTIONS);
00270     node_type_socket_templates(&ntype, cmp_node_bilateralblur_in, cmp_node_bilateralblur_out);
00271     node_type_size(&ntype, 150, 120, 200);
00272     node_type_init(&ntype, node_composit_init_bilateralblur);
00273     node_type_storage(&ntype, "NodeBilateralBlurData", node_free_standard_storage, node_copy_standard_storage);
00274     node_type_exec(&ntype, node_composit_exec_bilateralblur);
00275 
00276     nodeRegisterType(ttype, &ntype);
00277 }
